page.title: 05THE BRICKWORKS AT MOSS
page.content: Near{Moss}there are the remains of the old{brickworks.}These were built in the early 1700's and closed down in the 1920's. The tall{chimney}with the words 'MOSS BRICKS' towers above the surrounding flat farm land. There are 3{kilns}remaining, one is in ruins and shows the burnt bricks, one is empty and the last is full of bricks that were never fired. The{quarry}has now flooded and has been stocked with{fish for the local fishing club. It is a source of{wild flowers}such as water lilies, irises, deadly nightshade and campion.{Swifts}can be seen swooping above the surface of the lake.
